events.name: Our inaugural meetup!

venue.name: Just Eat
venue.address_1: 2nd Floor Broad Quay House, Prince Street, BS1 4DJ

events.description:
This will be our first meetup and hopefully a great start to our new Google Developer Group. We have 2 talks scheduled, and we are kindly being hosted by Just Eat who will provide beer and pizza. I wonder if they'll use their own app to order it?

Rough Schedule:

19:00 - Meet and greet, have a drink and get to know each other!

19:30 - Intro to the GDG, Google's global developer community

19:45 - Andre will give a show and tell on Google Pub/Sub, the asynchronous messaging service that Google use to send 500 million messages per second.

20:15 - Tim will give a demonstration of automating Google Cloud infrastructure with Terraform.

20:45 - Closing comments, further beer & pizza.

We hope to see you there, and in the meantime please find out more about our group on our main meetup page.

events.name: Flutter Live! Viewing Party

venue.name: Just Eat
venue.address_1: 2nd Floor Broad Quay House, Prince Street, BS1 4DJ

events.description:
We're having a party!

On 4th December Google are hosting Flutter Live! - An event where they will be sharing a variety of news and updates about Flutter.

The session on 4th starts early, so we hosting a viewing party the day after on Wed 5th Dec where you can come and eat pizza, have some drinks, and watch the re-run of the livestream with us. You will also have the opportunity to network with your peers and ask us any questions that you may have.

After the stream, we will do a code lab which we encourage you to follow along. You'll be able to see just how easy it is to put together a fully functional Android/iOS app with a single codebase written in Dart.

Here's the agenda:

6:00 pm - Attendee arrival, drinks and networking
6:30 pm - Flutter Live! keynote speeches
8:00 pm - Break/drinks/pizza
8:15 pm - Flutter Code Lab
9:00 Close/pub

We really hope you will be able to join us. There will be some great highlights from the keynote!

For further info about Flutter see below:

Flutter homepage - http://flutter.io
Intro to Flutter - https://youtu.be/fq4N0hgOWzU
Twitter - @flutterio

events.name: Firebase, Kubernetes and Serverless Video Intelligence
events.description:
18:30 - Arrive and interact with other humans!
19:00 - Firebase from within Kubernetes - A show-n-tell from Andre
19:30 - Serverless Video Intelligence - A round up of serverless options in GCP with a live demo from Tim
20:30 - You don't have to go home but you can't stay here :-)

We will also hand out Qwiklabs vouchers so you can try out the code from the serverless demo yourself.

Venue hire and light refreshments are sponsored by www.claranet.co.uk!
events.how_to_find_us: We will be meeting in the DeskLodge Oak Tree room on the 4th floor of the old Evening Post building.

events.name: Next '19 Extended Bristol

venue.name: Just Eat
venue.address_1: 2nd Floor Broad Quay House, Prince Street, BS1 4DJ

events.description:
Join us for this year's Next Extended event! We are excited to bring together the local developer community to be part of the Google Next '19 experience and learn more about exciting new tools and services straight out of Next '19 in San Francisco. We will be presenting and demoing some of the new product launches and then collaborating on a live code lab together. All skill levels welcome!

Everyone who attends will get free Qwiklabs credits to complete the Kubernetes Solutions quest. That's 10 different labs to complete in your own time (about $50 worth!)

And if that's not enough, there will also be swag!

Plus beer, non-beer, pizza and a great bunch of humans. Bring your laptop!

Pizza will be ready for 18:30 so please come and grab some early on :)

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2019 Bristol

venue.name: Just Eat
venue.address_1: 2nd Floor Broad Quay House, Prince Street, BS1 4DJ

events.description:
Join us for this year's I/O Extended event! I/O brings together developers from around the globe for talks, hands-on learning with Google experts, and a first look at Google’s latest developer products.

7pm - Pizza!

7:20pm - Fahad has returned from I/O in Mountain View and will be giving us all the latest news on MotionLayout, Jetpack Compose, Stadia (Google's new streaming console-as-a-service), and more!

7:50pm - Tim will give a quick demo of Cloud Code, the new Skaffold/GKE functionality for VSCode and IntelliJ.

8:10pm - Google I/O branded swag giveaway, followed by tech chat social time!

Beer, soft-drinks and a great bunch of humans will be provided!

events.name: Lightning Talks!

venue.name: Just Eat
venue.address_1: 2nd Floor Broad Quay House, Prince Street, BS1 4DJ

events.description:
We are excited to host our first lightning talks evening, featuring a bunch of exciting talks from our amazing community members!

Talks confirmed so far:

Social Sentiment Analysis with Dan Jones
We Are Neurodiverse with Sam Downie
Tekton: Kubernetes Native CI/CD Pipelines with Aled James
Telepresence for Integration Testing with Ben King
Sprinkle some Fusion on your Data with Mandy Bailey

There is still space if you'd like to join in! Talks can feature any Google topic: Android, Cloud, ML/AI, Data, Flutter, Tensorflow, app dev, you name it! Talks should be 5-10 minutes long and can take any format. You don't need shiny slides if you don't want them, just have something interesting to tell us about in a friendly, welcoming and inclusive atmosphere.

Please submit your talks here: https://forms.gle/SB5Lh21QFgQrCNNv6

events.name: Mr. Data's ML, AI and AIY Workshop

venue.name: Just Eat
venue.address_1: 2nd Floor Broad Quay House, Prince Street, BS1 4DJ

events.description:
Join us in welcoming our new robot overlords as we discuss all things big data, machine learning and artificial intelligence. We'll explore Google's range of off-the-shelf automated machine learning services and APIs and get hands-on with a Google AIY Vision Kit!

See https://aiyprojects.withgoogle.com/ for more information.

Agenda:

19:00 - Meet/Greet/Eat Pizza
19:30 - Google AIY Vision Kit with Fahad
20:00 - Google ML APIs with Tim
20:30 - Time permitting, we may stick around for additional food/drink and to tinker with the Voice Kit!

As per usual, pizza, beer, non-beer and a great bunch of humans will be provided!

events.name: September YAKM! (Yet Another Kubernetes Meetup)

venue.name: Just Eat
venue.address_1: 2nd Floor Broad Quay House, Prince Street, BS1 4DJ

events.description:
We're excited to present an evening of talks on this new thing you may not have heard of yet: Kubernetes. Apparently it's all the rage! We'll be discussing some moderately advanced features of this ubiquitous technology, detailed in the agenda below:

19:00 Arrival, pizza and drinks (including non-beer options)
19:30 "Regional Distributed Persistent Storage with GKE, Rook & Ceph" - Tim Berry (Claranet, acloud.guru) explores the pitfalls of persisting GCP volumes in regional GKE clusters and how you can make it work with rook.io.
20:00 "An Introduction to Kustomize" - Dan Jones (Paxport) will teach us how to avoid Helm altogether by composing configurable declarations with native Kubernetes tools.
20:30 Finish drinks, do the recycling etc.

We hope to see you there, fellow Kubernistas!

events.name: DevFest Bristol 2019
events.description:
We are excited to run our first annual DevFest! The schedule is still to be confirmed but we are planning to host tracks mostly in Cloud, Mobile and AI, featuring talks, demos and workshops. Space at our generous sponsor's venue is limited, so please only register if you can definitely make it!

See the event website for all details: https://devfest2019.gdgbristol.org/

PLEASE REGISTER VIA EVENTBRITE if you wish to attend DevFest :-)
Admission is free but to control capacity we can't admit anyone without an EventBrite ticket: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/devfest-bristol-2019-tickets-72702865227

We are now looking for speakers! Please see our CFP here: https://forms.gle/74f3pv3cieLwbpAx9

For more details see https://devfest.withgoogle.com

events.name: The Serverless Holy Trinity and Learning to Go

venue.name: Just Eat
venue.address_1: 2nd Floor Broad Quay House, Prince Street, BS1 4DJ

events.description:
It's 2020 and we're back! Having just about recovered our strength after DevFest we're happy to be bringing you our first meetup of the year. Dan will be providing us with a comparison and discussion of the three GCP-native serverless solutions, and Tim will be talking about how you can learn Go, when all of the online tutorials and reference materials so far appear to have been written in Latin. Everyone is welcome! Everything is fine!

Agenda:

19:00 - Meet/Greet/Eat Pizza
19:30 - Cloud Native Holy Trinity with Dan Jones
20:00 - Learning to Go with Tim Berry
20:30 - Redistribute extraneous pizzas

As per usual sustenance for human ingestion will be supplied!

events.name: Lying To Your Boss's Slack Bot & It's Always (Hybrid Cloud) DNS

venue.name: Just Eat
venue.address_1: 2nd Floor Broad Quay House, Prince Street, BS1 4DJ

events.description:
GDG Bristol is excited to bring you 2 new awesome talks from our community members!

Automating Toil by Lying to Your Boss’s Slack Bot
James Laverack, Jetstack

At Jetstack we practice asynchronous stand-ups, posting what we’re doing in a Slack channel every morning for a custom Slack bot to parse and report on. I was attending a conference for a week, so I knew what I’d be doing the whole week in advance. However, our slack bot doesn’t let you pre-post reports. So, in true over-engineering style, I built my own Slack bot to automate posting of my pre-written stand-ups every day. It runs entirely on Google Cloud, and costs pennies to run.

It's Always (Hybrid Cloud) DNS
Stu Watts, ForgeRock

In a large hybrid cloud organisation, DNS is just as important as your networking. With a cross-vendor demo, this talk will delve into some of the features of Cloud DNS that you can use to stay sane, and get things... resolved.

Agenda:

19:00 - Meet/Greet/Eat Pizza
19:30 - It's Always (Hybrid Cloud) DNS
20:00 - Automating Toil by Lying to Your Boss’s Slack Bot
20:30 - Redistribute extraneous pizzas

As per usual sustenance for human ingestion will be supplied!

events.name: [ONLINE] GDG Bristol April Virtual Meetup
events.description: We're pleased to announce our first online virtual meetup! As the first of our meetups taking place entirely online, it'll be even more informal than usual but will still include a feature presentation and a chance to socialise (with guaranteed safe physical distance) with other technology enthusiasts. In this first virtual meetup, Tim Berry will take us through building a big data pipeline with Pub/Sub, Dataflow and BigQuery, then using it to flag naughty words in fake tweets. The meeting will take place via Zoom (sorry Google! It gives us a few more features than Hangouts). Bring your own pizza and drinks!

events.name: Community Speedrun Challenge #1:  Baseline: Data, ML, AI
events.description:
Hello!

We’re sure most of you are interested in learning new technologies and tools. That’s why we’re excited to participate in the Community Speedrun Challenge that Google is organizing for developer communities in Europe. And as part of the GDG Bristol community, you’re among the first to know about this!

The Community Speedrun Challenge is a training program that will run in May where you’ll have the opportunity to join four Speedruns and get hands-on experience with Machine Learning on Google Cloud, and take your first steps with tools like BigQuery, Cloud Speech API, and Cloud ML Engine. Every Speedrun is open for a week to give you the ability to finish all labs in your best time, scoring more points and winning prizes.

PLEASE NOTE: This event is run by Google, and you must register on the Community Speedrun Challenge website to participate!

Find more information and to register go to: https://bit.ly/speedrunchallengeeurope

Schedule:
Speedrun Start Dates: May 4th, 11th, 18th, and 25th
Webinar Time: Mondays from 7pm to 9pm (GMT+2)
(Google publish times as GMT+2, British Summer Time is GMT+1 so the Meetup event times should be correct!)

Topics
Baseline: Data, ML, AI with Zack Akil (Google)
Intro to ML: Language Processing with Dale Markowitz (Google)
Intermediate ML with Lee Boonstra (Google)
BigQuery for Machine Learning with Felipe Hoffa (Google)

events.name: DevParty - UK & Ireland
events.description:
IT'S TIME FOR DEVPARTY 2020 - UK & IRELAND!

(GDG Bristol isn't hosting this event but we're pleased to promote it on behalf of GDG UK & Ireland. You must register at https://dev-party.io if you wish to attend, but please also RSVP here so we know how many Bristolian GDGers we're sending!)

GDG (Google Developer Group) UK and Ireland are very excited to invite you to DevParty, an online event which offers interactive talks and workshops from experts in a range of fields, and provides a great chance to connect with other developers from all across the UK and Ireland!

There will be 3 talk sessions per track. The 4 tracks are - mobile, cloud technologies, interactive webinars on machine learning, as well as fascinating discussions on ethics and diversity in the world of software development all running alongside each other to ensure you have plenty of content to get involved with.

IT'S NOT ALL ABOUT THE TECH, OF COURSE!

But, of course, it’s not all about the tech! Following the interactive sessions we will get together for an online party, where you can chat, network and maybe have a drink or two; this is a rare opportunity to get to know fellow developers from all over, whether local or on the other side of the country.

So (virtually) come on down and get involved on Saturday 16th May - we look forward to seeing you!

Register for this online event and let’s get the DevParty started! Go to https://dev-party.io for more details and to register!

DON'T FORGET TO CONNECT WITH US ON SOCIAL MEDIA, SO YOU DON'T MISS ANY UPDATES!

Find us on >>
Twitter - https://twitter.com/devparty_
Instagram - https://instagram.com/devparty_
Facebook - https://facebook.com/devpartyukireland
YouTube - https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCuAj2rWo6S8Vbovya0eX6oA

organizers.name: Andre
organizers.bio: gamer, player, team mate, winner, loser, clown...

group_profile.title: Founder
group_profile.intro:
Architect, developer and build Meister for the Java platform.

After all these years, I still enjoy working as a developer; I still like to learn more and share what I know.

organizers.name: Tim B.
organizers.bio: Technical Instructor @acloudguru. Certified @GCPCloud Architect/Data Engineer/Developer. Also writing+gamedev!

group_profile.title: Founder
group_profile.intro: SRE Player/Coach for Google Cloud Platform @Claranet Public Cloud. Previously DevOps @ForgeRock. Certified @GCPCloud Professional. Also writing+gamedev!
